thread.title: Extra point valid despite flying off referee's head in Midland Lee game against El Dorado
thread.title_full: Extra point valid despite flying off referee's head in Midland Lee game against El Dorado

title: Extra point valid despite flying off referee's head in Midland Lee game against El Dorado
text:
Assist: The ball cannons off the referee's face.
A high school American football player managed to kill two birds with one stone, smacking a referee in the head while simultaneously making sure of an extra point opportunity.
Midland Lee kicker Luis Aranda lined up for the conversion after a touchdown in the second quarter of a game against El Dorado High School in Texas.
The ball came off the boot badly and seemed destined to miss, that is until it smashed into the referee standing directly in line with the middle of the posts.
The missile knocked off the referee's hat, deflected upwards onto the crossbar and went through for the point.
Advertisement As in football, the referee is deemed part of the playing field in American football, meaning the deflection was of no consequence.
The man in black was not overly perturbed, picking up his cap and getting on with the job.
smh.com.au
